Posts.Title: How Many Are We? DivineMrsM kt1966

Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2013 03:09PM - edited Feb 22, 2013 03:16PM by svetik I did clinical trial between chemos. It was also targeted therapy for triple negative but different drug (Foretinib). I had only few weeks to enter so I went for it. I liked that I was closely monitored during the trial. They took me off the trial and put back on chemo as soon as the new treatment stopped working. There were almost no side effects on this trial, so it gave me a nice 3 months break. I know that there are women who stay on Foretinib much longer. All trials are different. Some have very strong even life-threatening side effects. It also depends on the phase of a trial. Phase I can be more risky than phase II because some side effects may be unknown.  I agree with Sheryl. Check if you can stop this trial and then start chemo if necessary. But I really hope that if you choose the trial (or chemo), it works for you.   Good luck! Lana
Posts.Title: Chemo or Clinical trial???? Don't know what to do Evans1128 Fitztwins

Posts.Content: May 4, 2013 03:49AM svetik wrote: My coworkers took me for a dinner once... it was very nice of them but all they mostly talked about was how many years they have until retirement. That was almost funny to me. I realized that most of them do not know what stage 4 means. I did not want to explain or complain as I still need this job. They really did not want to hurt my feelings. My SIL however called me yesterday and said that only if I could ask God for forgiveness… I guess the ending to this sentence was supposed to be “I would be healed”. How evil does she think I am? Anyways, since she went all religious on me, I had to remind her story from the scriptures how Apostle Paul was ill and begged God to make him well and God said “No. But I am with you; that is all you need.” Well, she replied that I am giving up?!?! Maybe she felt lectured as I am usually the one who listens. This was probably my first time speaking up to her.

Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2013 02:22AM svetik wrote: I am here. I was diagnosed as stage 4 from the start in January 2012 with mets to my neck and chest (close to the heart). I had to go to the emergency room with a burning chest pain,  and this is when I was first told about the cancer. Chemo shrinked the mets a little, so I am not in much pain right now, but the thing has now spread to my spleen, left lung, and left thigh.
